pros: So rewarding ! Flexible and interesting
cons: There are no downsides to this work

job_title: Family Coach Supervisor in Janesville, WI
pros: Wonderful mission, such as providing families with social supports and connecting them to community resources. Great way to make community connections and build connectivity within the religious community
cons: Benefits are not great Pay isn’t enough due to nonprofit Does not have LGBTQ inclusive education for volunteers looking to host.

review_title: Meaningful work but top leadership needs to change
pros: mission and vision, meaningful and inspiring
cons: upper level leadership needs overhaul. Too controlling

pros: Culture, Belonging, community, vision and mission
cons: Growing organization with constant change

pros: The team are fantastic, supportive and enthusiastic. The vision of the Charity is amazing.
cons: There is often a big workload.

pros: amazing mission & working with incredible families and volunteers
cons: -high expectations -not enough training/ onboarding

pros: Great vision, trying to keep families together and strengthen them without involving child welfare systems.
cons:
Poor leadership that isn't willing to change and gaslights employees. No representation of the people served in the staff and leadership. No opportunity for the people served to have influence and voice into practices, policies, and standards. Leadership is not transparent nor supportive. Training, support, and resources not sufficient to handle the complex needs of families. 

There's no room to grow and to move forward in the organization. Responsibilities are added without any additional support, compensation, or advancement. The expectation is that employees are available 24/7 and have their phones on them at all times, leading to high burn out rates in employees. The Chicago chapter has experienced extremely high turnover because of issues with the leadership and no changes have been made.

pros: Fulfilling job, provided interns to help with workload
cons: Poor leadership, overworked, undervalued and supported, low pay, lack of infastructure to support long term growth, duplicity in promises from leadership

pros: Great supervisor, good cause, opportunity to interact with local community
cons: pay is less than I would like

review_title: Amazing Vision, but leadership can be challenging
pros: You have a lot of hands-on work, helping families stay together and do not have to enter the foster care system! Build amazing relationships with your clients, network with agencies in your local area, and have great volunteers to work with! It's busy when you have referrals, a lot of coordination and connections!
cons: Typically there are only 2 paid staff per a chapter and the rest is based on your volunteer base. If you are short of volunteers, you cannot say "yes" to a family in crisis. As Family Coach, you have the referral phone on you 24/7 everyday. You are responsible to respond to crisis or emergencies right away and have to request time off, which makes you limited on the travel plans you might want to have on a weekend.

review_title: Solid program, agency needs work in terms of racial equity and LGBTQ outreach
pros: Model is impressive and fills a gap in services.
cons: National chapter is behind inclusivity.

pros: Great mission, leadership listens to employee input and concerns, dedicated, compassionate colleagues
cons:
Fairly uncompetitive pay
Turn over
Not a lot opportunities for advancement

pros: Wonderful team of people to work alongside.
cons: Challenging to grow due to lack of professionalism within organization.

pros: The joy of knowing that your love, care and concern for the clients your work for is not in vain. To see children improve while under the care of Lydia and receiving necessary mental health services is a great rewards within itself. The basic values the organization has are great. They have yet to execute those goals successfully.
cons: Childcare workers are not respected by the head of the administration and therefore the rest of the upper level supervision reflects the same attitude. Without our work and input, the children would be without the necessary tools to grow into a healthy mental, physical and spiritual place in their lives. The childcare workers are not given proper breaks and lunch breaks. The administration focuses mainly on the childcare worker generating paperwork to garner more funding versus the actual care of each need of the children individually. This and many other factors cause unnecessary stress while on the job. Their is not room for growth and very little consideration for the health and work-life balance of the childcare worker.

pros: There are a lot of people who really want to help kids.
cons: Budget cuts lead to the loss of high quality staff and a constant cycle of case workers sporting 2-3 MONTHS of experience.  The thinking behind Safe Families is amazing and innovative, but it was not uncommon to be chewed out by supervisors for attempting to blow the whistle on a dangerous biological family situation, and I observed consistent pressure on mandatory reporters (the Safe Families themselves) to not report abuse or neglect as that "violated the spirit of the program."

review_title: A good place to work. It was nice working in a place where the staff also became family.
job_title: Child Care Worker in Chicago, IL
pros: I love working with the children, and on some outings you was able to bring your family.
cons: Only the pay can be better

pros: Really passionate people, super rewarding job
cons: low to average pay for social work, a small organization that varies from state to state, so not a ton of room to grow

job_title: Child Care Worker in Chicago, IL
